senses.sense_definition: The first five books of the Hebrew Scriptures, traditionally attributed to Moses.

examples.text: The rabbi read a portion from the <w>Torah</w> during the Saturday morning service.
Tradition teaches that Moses received the <w>Torah</w> on Mount Sinai.

senses.sense_definition: The entire body of Jewish religious law, learning, and tradition, including both written and oral texts.

examples.text: He dedicated his entire life to the study of <w>Torah</w> and Jewish ethics.
Many important moral values in Western society have roots in the <w>Torah</w>.

senses.sense_definition: A specially written scroll containing the five books of Moses, used in religious services.

examples.text: The congregation stood in respect as the <w>Torah</w> was taken out of the ark.
An anonymous donor provided a beautiful new <w>Torah</w> for the synagogue.
